DataElement.preferredName: Recurrent Disease Superficial Bladder Cancer Diagnosis Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date on which recurrence of superficial bladder cancer was diagnosed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Recurrent Disease Superficial Bladder Cancer Diagnosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the diagnosis or identification of the return of an infiltrating carcinoma that has not invaded into the muscularis propia of the urinary bladder wall regardless of the histologic type or grade after a period of remission.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: the return of a sign, symptom, or disease after a remission.:Superficial Bladder Cancer is a term used by urologists to describe infiltrating carcinomas that have not invaded into the muscularis propia of the urinary bladder wall regardless of their histologic type or grade, and therefore it does not represent a pathologic entity.  It is important for the term stage 0is bladder cancer (carcinoma in situ of the bladder) not to be equated with superficial bladder cancer.  Stage I bladder cancer may be considered superficial. --2003

Concepts.definition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.
An infiltrating carcinoma of the bladder that has not invaded into the bladder muscularis propria.

Property.preferredDefinition: The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/3/17 tt added Diagnosis CSI. 6/20/17 jk transferred to NCI Standards per confirmation by Brian Campbell as part of Round 5 finalization task, added reg status.
